{{cpp/chrono/time_zone/title|to_sys}}
{{cpp/chrono/time_zone/navbar}}
{{dcl begin}}
{{dcl|num=1|since=c++20|
template&lt; class Duration &gt;
auto to_sys( const std::chrono::local_time&lt;Duration&gt;&amp; tp ) const
    -&gt; std::chrono::sys_time&lt;std::common_type_t&lt;Duration, std::chrono::seconds&gt;&gt;;
}}
{{dcl|num=2|since=c++20|
template&lt; class Duration &gt;
auto to_sys( const std::chrono::local_time&lt;Duration&gt;&amp; tp, std::chrono::choose z ) const
    -&gt; std::chrono::sys_time&lt;std::common_type_t&lt;Duration, std::chrono::seconds&gt;&gt;;
}}
{{dcl end}}

Converts the {{lc|std::chrono::local_time|local_time}} {{c|tp}} in this time zone to the corresponding {{lc|std::chrono::sys_time|sys_time}}.

@1@ Throws an exception if the conversion is ambiguous or if {{c|tp}} represents a nonexistent time.
@2@ Resolves ambiguity according to the value of {{c|z}}:
*If {{c|1=z == std::chrono::choose::earliest}}, returns the earlier {{tt|sys_time}}.
*If {{c|1=z == std::chrono::choose::latest}}, returns the later {{tt|sys_time}}.
@@ If {{c|tp}} represents a nonexistent time between two UTC {{tt|time_point}}s, those two {{tt|time_point}}s will be the same, and that {{tt|time_point}} will be returned.

===Return value===
The UTC equivalent of {{c|tp}} according to the rules of this time zone.

===Exceptions===
@1@ Throws:
* {{c|std::chrono::ambiguous_local_time}} if the conversion is ambiguous,
* {{c|std::chrono::nonexistent_local_time}} if {{c|tp}} represents a nonexistent time.

===Notes===
The precision of the result is at least {{lc|std::chrono::seconds}}, and will be finer if the argument has finer precision.

Ambiguous and nonexistent local times can occur as a result of time zone transitions (such as daylight saving time). For example, {{c|"2016-03-13 02:30:00"}} does not exist in the {{c|"America/New_York"}} time zone, while {{c|"2016-11-06 01:30:00"}} in that time zone can correspond to two UTC time points: {{c|2016-11-06 05:30:00 UTC}} and {{c|2016-11-06 06:30:00 UTC}}.
